PatientDetails.Name: Jeffrey Cochran
HospitalCourse: Admitted with pneumonia and empyema on 09/16/2024.
Underwent bronchoscopy with aspiration and right thoracotomy on 09/17/2024.
Experienced sepsis secondary to right lower lobe pneumonia.
Notable for worsening leukocytosis, started on IV antibiotics and transitioned to PO antibiotics.

InfectionIndicators.BloodCulture: Normal respiratory flora, operative culture positive for GPC
InfectionIndicators.UnexplainedHypoxia: Oxygen saturation fluctuated, required supplemental oxygen

Sepsis.ClinicalNotes: Sepsis was present at admission and managed appropriately. Worsening leukocytosis was observed.

BloodProducts.HemoglobinLevels: Lowest recorded Hgb of 8.1, transfusions implemented if Hgb <7.
